text: A supercell is a strong type of thunderstorm with a thick, rotating updraft (a mesocyclone). Supercell thunderstorms are the largest, most dangerous type of thunderstorms. There are really only two types of thunderstorms: supercell and ordinary, but some have four classifications: single-cell, multi-cell, squall line, and supercell. == References == * Structure and Dynamics of Supercell Thunderstorms - NWS * University of Illinois World Weather Project * Weather Glossary for Storm Spotters - NWS * Lemon, Leslie R.
